intro: Lepturus incurvatus f. major, commonly known as the large-leafed lepturus, is a botanical variant characterized by its notably larger leaves compared to the typical form. This plant belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. Its foliage is typically lobed and has a distinct, slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments, thriving in woodland areas or along stream banks.
